name: Peppers Spinach Garlic Cajun Quick Farfalle
description: Peppers spinach garlic cajun quick farfalle. A delicious and easy pasta dish packed full of veggies. Great for weeknights.

recipeInstructions.text: Boil the farfalle with water and 3/4 teaspoon salt and keep aside when ready.
recipeInstructions.name: Boil the farfalle with water and 3/4 teaspoon salt and keep aside when ready.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan, add vegetable oil and onions and cook on medium heat until onions are translucent.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pan, add vegetable oil and onions and cook on medium heat until onions are translucent.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the bell peppers and cook for another 5-7 minutes until the peppers start to soften up.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the bell peppers and cook for another 5-7 minutes until the peppers start to soften up.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the spinach and olive oil and cook on medium heat stirring frequently for 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the spinach and olive oil and cook on medium heat stirring frequently for 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the tomatoes, 1/4 teaspoon salt, black pepper, chili flakes, cajun spice and lemon juice and give it a toss for a few seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the tomatoes, 1/4 teaspoon salt, black pepper, chili flakes, cajun spice and lemon juice and give it a toss for a few seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the cooked Farfalle or any pasta and toss it well and let it simmer for 2-3 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot topped with the mexican cheese and sprinkled cajun spice!
